body:
You are on the right track, but have made a very minor mistake.

The color format that you are using is wrong. From the official docs of Android,

Supported formats are: #RRGGBB #AARRGGBB or one of the following names: 'red', 'blue', 'green', 'black', 'white', 'gray', 'cyan', 'magenta', 'yellow', 'lightgray', 'darkgray', 'grey', 'lightgrey', 'darkgrey', 'aqua', 'fuchsia', 'lime', 'maroon', 'navy', 'olive', 'purple', 'silver', 'teal'.

So, basically you are using a wrong color format for the parseColor() method. Just remove one extra # and you are good to go.

footer.setBackgroundColor(Color.parseColor("#ffb5d6e1"));

BONUS

For simplicity, you can also remove the opacity component from your color. You are setting the opacity to 100% by using "ff" but this the default behaviour as well. So you can just remove this component and keep it simple, like this, 

footer.setBackgroundColor(Color.parseColor("#b5d6e1"));
title: How to set a background color for linear layout programatically?
